name: Daisy Method
description: Use when: You're starting a scrambled cube and white edges are scattered. Look for white edges anywhere on the cube and bring them to surround the yellow center on top (forming a 'daisy'), then flip each one down to the bottom by aligning it with the matching center and doing F2.

steps.label: Flip edge from daisy down to bottom cross
Rotate bottom to open the next slot
Move the next edge out of the way

name: Edge Flip in Place
description: Use when: A white edge is in the correct bottom-layer position but the white sticker faces down instead of to the side (or vice versa). The edge is in its slot but flipped wrong. This sequence takes it out, flips it, and puts it back correctly.

steps.label: Pull the edge out of its slot
Move it aside on the top layer
Flip it into the correct orientation
Undo the top-layer turn to reinsert

name: Edge from Right Layer
description: Use when: A white edge is stuck in the middle layer on the right side. You can see the white sticker facing you on the right-side middle slot. This pulls it out and places it on the bottom cross.

steps.label: Move the edge down out of the middle layer
Rotate bottom to align edge with its center

name: Edge from Left Layer
description: Use when: A white edge is stuck in the middle layer on the left side. Mirror of the right-layer case. Pulls the edge out and places it on the bottom cross.

steps.label: Move the edge down out of the middle layer
Rotate bottom to align edge with its center
